title: Sources say prominent US rocket-maker United Launch Alliance is up for sale
summary: The potential sale of ULA comes with many questions for a buyer.

title: UK provisionally clears Viasat’s Inmarsat acquisition
summary: The U.K. provisionally cleared Viasat’s plan to buy London-based Inmarsat March 1 after finding the deal would not substantially reduce competition for providing Wi-Fi on planes.

title: Virgin Galactic in final phases of return to flight
summary: Virgin Galactic is in the final phases of returning its suborbital spaceplane to commercial service as it ramps up development of a next-generation vehicle.

title: SpaceX, NASA target Thursday morning for Crew-6 launch
summary: SpaceX and NASA are now targeting Thursday morning for a launch of four people to the International Space Station (ISS) after an issue with the TEA-TEB engine ignition system scrubbed Monday’s attempt.

title: Apple lends Globalstar $252 million for satellite-enabled iPhones
summary: Globalstar said Feb. 28 that Apple is lending the company $252 million to help cover upfront costs for replenishing its low Earth orbit constellation.

title: Rocket Lab quarterly revenue stays steady as space company doubles order backlog
summary: Rocket Lab said Tuesday it has doubled its order backlog — from about $241 million in contracts at the end of 2021 to $503.6 million at the end of 2022 — and made progress on the Neutron rocket it’s developing.

title: NASA Awards Contract Supporting Langley’s Research, Science Services
summary: NASA has awarded a contract to Analytical Mechanics Associates of Hampton, Virginia, for services to support NASA Langley Research Center’s research, engineering, and science services (RSES).

title: Virgin Galactic completes lengthy upgrade process ahead of resuming spaceflights
summary: Virgin Galactic said on Tuesday it remains on track to resume spaceflights in the coming months after completing upgrades to its carrier aircraft and spacecraft.

title: Industry group to examine potential security threats in cislunar space
summary: The Space Information Sharing and Analysis Center, or Space ISAC, is forming a group to focus on the security threats the United States could face in cislunar space outside Earth orbit.

title: iSpace On Track For First Lunar Landing, Preparing For Next Missions
summary: Japanese lunar lander company ispace confirms its first mission is on track to attempt a lunar landing in two months as work continues on next two missions.
